speaker: BO TAYLOR
line: You boys eat your vegetables or I'll do the same to you!

speaker: COOK
line: Hot meat, Senor.

speaker: ENGINEER
line: ¡Hey Amigo! ¿Que pasó esta noche? How was the roast beef? ¿Que cómo está el carne? ¿Bueno o malo?

speaker: BO TAYLOR
line: Who's our communications officer?

speaker: BO TAYLOR
line: Hey, what gives with the...

speaker: BO TAYLOR
line: What the hell are you doing?

speaker: BO TAYLOR
line: Enough.

speaker: BO TAYLOR
line: Oh man.

speaker: BO TAYLOR
line: Now you gone and done it.

speaker: DE LA CRUZ
line: ¡Déjeme! ¡Déjeme! No, no, no, no, nooo, nooo-oooooooo....

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Am I interrupting anything, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Nothing you'd be too terribly interested in Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Mulder. What are you doing down here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Looking into the recent death of an oil worker.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I got a heads up from you a couple of days ago.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's what I'm doing here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Mulder, I understand you have more than just a proprietary interest in these cases, but I can't help it if you're not assigned to this unit any more. I didn't see any reason to pursue this oil worker case.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well maybe you missed the fact that this victim's corpse washes ashore in Port Arransis, Texas with massive flash burns on 90% of his body.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I read the report Agent Mulder, if you're insinuating I didn't.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then you must also know that this man was not the only man to disappear from the Galpex-Orpheus platform that night, but one of two men. The communications officer is also missing.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The company attributes that to an explosion on the rig, a blowout. Which is what they say caused Simon de la Cruz his burns.

speaker: MULDER
line: Burns the M.E. said in his report we not inconsistent to exposure to high levels of radiation.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Not inconsistent. It's not exactly who I call a ringing endorsement.

speaker: MULDER
line: These files include the same kind of radiation phenomenon. Tissue destroyed by exposure to...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Black oil. Five years ago, you and Agent Scully investigated a case of a World War Two plane salvaged from the bottom of the Pacific Ocean, where a sepsis was brought to the surface which you describe as a highly contagious virus of extra-terrestrial origin. That has radioactive properties and can take over a man's body. And it's part of an alien conspiracy to colonise the planet, if I'm not mistaken.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you'd love to help, but you left your light-sabre at home.

speaker: MULDER
line: How'd you get stuck down here, Agent Doggett? Kersh catch you peeing in his cornflakes?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: John Doggett.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The Deputy Director is waiting, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, I was just on my way up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why didn't you tell me you were pursuing the Texas oil worker case?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: 'Cause I'm not.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well there's an executive here from the oil company who says he was contacted by a man in our office.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That'd be Agent Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm gonna to let him answer that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Just like old times.

speaker: KERSH
line: Now it's all making sense.

speaker: MULDER
line: Tough crowd.

speaker: KERSH
line: Mr. Ortega, this is Special Agent Fox Mulder, the person you spoke to on the phone, I believe. Mr. Ortega is Vice President of Operations for Galpex Petroleum out of Galveston, Texas.

speaker: MULDER
line: I believe we did speak, yeah.

speaker: KERSH
line: There's also confusion about who spoke to certain Government officials who seem to think the FBI is running an investigation into the accident.

speaker: MULDER
line: That would have been me as well, Sir, and that was in the best interest of the FBI and Mr. Ortega. I believe.

speaker: KERSH
line: Mr. Ortega would beg to differ, as would I.

speaker: ORTEGA
line: You complicated an already sensitive situation, Agent Mulder. Galpex Petroleum has discovered what we think may be a massive new oil province beneath the Gulf of Mexico. One that would give a huge advantage, financially and politically, to whoever gets to drill it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who else are we talking about?

speaker: ORTEGA
line: US territorial water cover the northern half of the Gulf. Our wells are on our side, but the field may spread well to the south. The Government of Mexico could claim it's theirs.

speaker: MULDER
line: This incident has nothing to do with that whatsoever. It's about the unexplained death of Simon de la Cruz.

speaker: ORTEGA
line: Simon de la Cruz was a Mexican national killed in a US business enterprise. They'd like nothing better than to use his death to get us to abandon the Orpheus rig so they can be the first to drill the province

speaker: KERSH
line: Leaving me no choice now but to conduct a criminal investigation, quickly and quietly, to take away any legal position that would affect American interests.

speaker: MULDER
line: A criminal investigation isn't doing to clear up anything.

speaker: KERSH
line: You've done more than enough Agent Mulder, thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think you know exactly what you're dealing with here Sir.

speaker: KERSH
line: No, I think I do Agent.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is an X-File.

speaker: KERSH
line: And I'm sending someone from the X Files to investigate.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're talking about an oil rig that's 150 miles out at sea. You cant send a pregnant woman.

speaker: KERSH
line: I'm not sending Agent Scully.

speaker: YURI
line: Yuri Volkov, Communications Specialist.

speaker: SACHS
line: Bring the new gear?

speaker: YURI
line: Yes, it's in there.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: John Doggett, Special Agent.

speaker: SACHS
line: Who?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: From the Bureau.

speaker: SACHS
line: FBI you say?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah. Someone told you I was coming I hope.

speaker: SACHS
line: No, got some new comm equipment.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You had radio problems? No-one told you about me coming?

speaker: SACHS
line: They got got shipped ashore. When they gave us the message it said just one Agent was coming.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Right, I'm the one Agent.

speaker: SACHS
line: Well then, who's the guy who get here this morning? Been talking to the crew chief for an hour.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Mulder, can I have a word with you?

speaker: MULDER
line: If you give me a minute, I'm just getting in with details of the investigation. Why don't you pull up a chair and introduce yourself so Mr. Taylor won't have to repeat himself.

speaker: TAYLOR
line: I'm Bo Taylor. I was on night watch the day this thing went down.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Go on Mr. Taylor.

speaker: TAYLOR
line: Men can go off the deep end out here, it's like a cabin fever of sorts. They're hundreds of miles away from their family and friends, 6 weeks at a stretch. Some of them might just well be doing hard time.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So how does that figure with the victim, Simon de la Cruz?

speaker: TAYLOR
line: Well, mestizos are normally the most reliable men I know off on the drill floor. Simon, just lost his nut I guess. It's the only good explanation.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Simon de la Cruz's body was found with flash burns. What's that got to do with him going off the deep end?

speaker: TAYLOR
line: Well hell, he tried to blow the whole damn rig. I mean it was sabotage, pure and simple. He knocked a cock of the gas valve, he must have sparked it cause it went faster than a Friday paycheck.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What about the second victim?

speaker: MULDER
line: Communications chief, wasn't he?

speaker: TAYLOR
line: He probably never knew what hit him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What's the communications chief doing on the drilling floor?

speaker: TAYLOR
line: A man can die out here sir, just going for a walk. Probably what happened when it blew. Nobody knew he was gone until the shift change.

speaker: MULDER
line: I guess that's it, in a nutshell. Thank you Mr. Taylor.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Mulder...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Mulder, don't walk away when I'm talking to you. Like it or not I've been assigned this case. One call to the Deputy Director and your up for insubordination.

speaker: MULDER
line: How are you going to call when the radio's broken?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Don't push me Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: You won't do it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You think?

speaker: MULDER
line: We're both in the same boat, Agent Doggett. We're just paddling in different directions.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No we're not going in different directions here, we're going in one direction. My direction.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think Kersh expects you to come back empty handed on this one. Since you have already told me about what you think about this case in so many words, I don't see you coming back with anything that's gonna protect anybody's business interests let alone your own ass.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well you really got me pegged. Anything that doesn't fit in my narrow field of vision might as well not exist, is that right Agent Mulder? So why is this man Taylor lying? You do know he's lying?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think he knows that truth about what happened, and he may not be the only one.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I never would have believed it. These stories about you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Really, what stories are those?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That you can find a conspiracy at a church picnic.

speaker: MULDER
line: What church?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Close the door and lock it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What's going on? You said you wanted to see me straight away.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I didn't know who else to talk to, and I haven't been able to reach Agent Mulder.

speaker: SKINNER
line: About what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: About what I found in my autopsy of the oil rig victim, Simon de la Cruz

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully, this man's body was supposed to be transported back to Mexico completely intact.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I found it by accident in the third ventricle of his brain.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: No it's OK, it's alright.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What do you mean? I was under the impression that this stuff could literally jump into a man's body.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, it can, and I've seen that happen. But that's the thing - this man was clearly infected by the alien virus. It entered his system and it was massing in the pineal gland, but it's dead.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What killed it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well intuitively, you would say the same thing that killed him - exposure to high levels of radiation. But it makes no sense because the virus itself has radioactive properties.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Someone needs to tell Agent Doggett that. He needs to have some kind of idea as to what he's dealing with out there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, you need to tell Deputy Director Kersh that he has to order a controlled evacuation of that rig right now.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Don't tell me to go to Kersh with this evidence. Telling him to order an evacuation for something that you cant even explain

speaker: SCULLY
line: If the virus is loose, Agent Doggett's life is in danger.

speaker: SKINNER
line: We don't know that for sure. There are nearly two dozen men on that rig and not one other case. Why?

speaker: TAYLOR
line: Hey Yuri, heard you had some problems with the radio.

speaker: YURI
line: This gear's all online working fine. But there's some sort of high frequency interference that I have no idea how to get rid off. Hear that? That's the signal that's coming in. Filtering in across a large range of channels. I don't think I have any choice but to power down and restore.

speaker: TAYLOR
line: No, you can't do that!

speaker: YURI
line: I hate to argue with you.

speaker: MARINE OPERATOR
line: This is the marine operator for Galpex-Orpheus. Come in Orpheus. I have a priority transmission, repeat, this is a priority transmission.

speaker: YURI
line: This is Orpheus, go ahead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Orpheus, I've been trying to reach you for hours. This is Special Agent Dana Scully. I have an urgent message for an investigative agent on board, an Agent John Doggett.

speaker: YURI
line: I'm ready to take that message.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No I'm sorry, I need to speak with Agent Doggett directly.

speaker: MULDER
line: I got it Well I'm sorry, Agent Doggett's gone fishing. Can I take a message please?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I was just in the neighbourhood.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder you can't just flout orders like this. It's not like old times. Kersh isn't going to tolerate this.

speaker: MULDER
line: Kersh doesn't need to know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: You need me out here Scully, you know that better than anyone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'd hate to say as of this morning I'd have to agree.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who's flouting orders, you found something didn't you, in that victim's body. The virus?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes I did, and it's dead Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dead? What killed it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Possibly radiation.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's not possible.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know I know, and this could be an isolated event, but that he's infected at all means that everybody out there could be at risk. And that means you and Agent Doggett.

speaker: MULDER
line: We got to quarantine this rig.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No Mulder, you need to get off the rig. Have Agent Doggett give the order. We can quarantine you and the crew when we get back here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, if these men are infected the last place we want to is onshore where they can infect other people. You're sitting on the answer right there, Scully. The body, you find the virus, you can find what knocks it out, you can find what kills it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And what if I can't?

speaker: MULDER
line: When he's old enough, tell the kid I went down swinging!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let me talk to Agent Doggett.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Doggett's not here right now.

speaker: DOGETT
line: Who was that on the radio?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Who were you talking to?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hey!

speaker: MULDER
line: That was Agent Scully.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What did she say?

speaker: MULDER
line: She said it was lucky that I'm out here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No, you're lucky that I'm letting you stay. You got information important to this investigation then I damn well better know about it. I'm in charge out here, Agent.

speaker: MULDER
line: Alright, then go ahead and take charge, Only you might not like what it means in this case. What you're going to have to do with that information you're so anxious to have.

speaker: SACHS
line: Alright, listen up. I'm gonna make this brief. We've been given an order to quarantine the rig. At fourteen hundred hours we officially shut down and lock down. You're gonna be stuck here a while, all flights in and out have been suspended. I know I know, you're gonna have to cooperate until the FBI's certain everything is shipshape. Now for everybody's protection we need to all of us cooperate fully.

speaker: ED DELL
line: Oh man!

speaker: TAYLOR
line: Protection from what?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: From a possible contagion.

speaker: TAYLOR
line: Anybody here feel sick?

speaker: CREW
line: No!

speaker: SACHS
line: Alright, knock it off, I need everybody to check their water consumption, and we'll be cutting back to half rations.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've been going over the crew manifest Mr. Sachs, and there appears to be a problem.

speaker: SACHS
line: Problem with what?

speaker: MULDER
line: According to the manifest there's supposed to be eighteen men onboard. I count only seventeen including you.

speaker: SACHS
line: This is my whole crew in here. DE LA CRUZ, SIMON DELL, ED GARZA, DIEGO GORDON, MAC HARBOUR, ROBERT HOXWORTH, JACK

speaker: MULDER
line: Diego Garza, where's he?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Who?

speaker: SACHS
line: Deck hand. A friend of Simon de la Cruz. The man who tried to sabotage the rig. Well I'll be damned.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What, he's not here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Any idea where he might be?

speaker: SACHS
line: Well he didn't leave the rig, not by any means I know of.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you say we go and find him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: This man was exposed to a virus.

speaker: ORTEGA
line: And why do I need to see this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: To understand what your crew may be infected with. What they risk spreading on or off that rig.

speaker: ORTEGA
line: You understand Galpex is eager to cooperate, but shutting down a producing rig costs us in the neighbourhood of a hundred and fifty thousand dollars, a day, and according to my OIM, no-one on that rig is sick, they're just hungry and tired.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You don't know that for sure.

speaker: ORTEGA
line: Well, what symptoms would they be showing, what would we see?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Unexplained behaviour, possible detection in the eyes ..

speaker: ORTEGA
line: We've seen none of that.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're relying on suspect data.

speaker: ORTEGA
line: I'm relying on medical reports, and unless you give me more than this, I'm calling that Orpheus crew back in. bringing them home, and rotating a fresh crew onto that rig.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh my god.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So what are hoping to find Agent Mulder, honestly?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm hoping to find Diego Garza.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: There's no chance of that if you ask me. A man could disappear of this platform and no-one would even notice.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you see the crew manifest? It listed Diego Garza as mestizo, of mixed Mexican descent, just like his friend who died?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah. So what?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well the crew chief said these mestizo were particularly good workers, but we've got one dead trying to sabotage the rig and another missing. If he's one of their best workers you'd think someone would've noticed him missing.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah so maybe he's still here. Maybe he's just waiting to finish the job that killed his friend to protect Mexican oil.

speaker: MULDER
line: These men are hiding something, but that's not it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You know, I quarantine a whole damn oil rig without any evidence to support what you're saying, not one damn thing, but you still have yet to give me straight answer as to what you think is going on out here. If these men are hiding something, if they're protecting something, then what the hell is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know yet.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: And when you do, let me know, cause I've got to get on the radio to justify this action.

speaker: MULDER
line: I didn't come out here just to bust your ass. I'm telling you, I've seen this substance. I've seen it can take over a man's body. This crew could be infected and not even know it. They may have no idea they're being controlled.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This? This is what you're saying is going to take over my body? Well when's it going to kick in?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's not how it works. It body jumps from man to man, and I'm not sure that it's in all oil.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well that's a relief, because only ninety percent of the planet is dependent on the stuff.

speaker: MULDER
line: The man from Galpex oil lied...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What, he's infected too?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, that new oil field is already in production. It's already being pumped by this rig. That's how this crew got infected.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're reaching Agent Mulder

speaker: MULDER
line: Billions and billions of barrels lying right underneath us, waiting to be produced, waiting to infect that ninety percent of the planet you talked about.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: If these men are hiding something. That'd sure be something to hide.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Doggett what if that's why this man is hiding, this Diego Garza, because he knows what they're up to, and he knows what they're up to because he's the only one who's not infected with this alien virus.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Alright, he knows. Why doesn't he just come down here and tell us?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's the radio room!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'll go find another one.

speaker: KERSH
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir?

speaker: KERSH
line: You're in a hurry. To do what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: To continue with my work, Sir.

speaker: KERSH
line: I'm not privy to this work. I'd have thought this body would have been on its way back to Mexico.

speaker: KERSH
line: I obviously haven't been able to rely on those whose job it is to keep me apprised and informed. I have to rely on phone calls, like the call I received from Martin Ortega. Why doesn't somebody make me privy to who the hell gave the order to shut down that rig.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I did.

speaker: KERSH
line: Well I'm giving the order that this quarantine is lifted.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We could do that Sir, but all radio contact has been cut off.

speaker: KERSH
line: As soon as it's re-established I want that rig up and running, and the entire crew choppered off the Galpex-Orpheus and debriefed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, I think that would be a mistake...

speaker: KERSH
line: I think it would be a mistake not to, Agent Scully. And you're running out of mistakes, both you, and the Assistant Director. If I didn't know better, I'd say this was a Mulder stunt.

speaker: SACHS
line: This stuff was all brand new.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it about this room that inspires men to violence?

speaker: SACHS
line: You think this fire was set?

speaker: MULDER
line: Molotov cocktail anyone?

speaker: MULDER
line: Can I borrow your radio Mr. Sachs? Agent Doggett, you there?

speaker: MULDER'S VOICE ON RADIO
line: Agent Doggett, do you copy?

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Doggett. Come in Agent Doggett.

speaker: GARZA
line: Sangre colorada

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah my blood's red.

speaker: GARZA
line: Lo mataron a Simón. Soy el único que queda. Si me encuentran, me matan.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Tranquilo. I don't speak very good Spanish. Diego. Tu eres Diego Garza??

speaker: GARZA
line: Lo mataron, yo los miré. Ellos querían el radio. Por eso es que encendí la lumbre.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's too fast. You're saying you set the fire? What are you afraid of?

speaker: GARZA
line: Tenemos que detenerlos antes que sea muy tarde. Ya vienen! Ya vienen!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Vienen. Vienen They're coming? Who? Who's coming?

speaker: GARZA
line: Los platillos. Los platillos voladores.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think I've got something.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is an SEM image pulled at random from anonymous donors.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What off?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Blood. More specifically, normal T-cell antibodies. By comparison these are from the blood of the oil rig worker T-cells in impossible numbers. In layman's terms, this victim was a virus fighting machine.

speaker: SKINNER
line: How do you explain that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, there are isolated cultures. In northern Italy for one, where people are immune to certain diseases - heart disease in that case, through a genetic mutation.

speaker: SKINNER
line: So this man had what, kind of genetic immunity to the alien virus?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well his employment records list Mr. Simon de la Cruz as of mixed Mexican ancestry, when in fact he is Waicha Indian. The Waicha are an indigenous Mexican culture that has a rare undiluted gene pool. Now these genes may have an innate immunity to infection.

speaker: SKINNER
line: OK, so he was immune to the virus. That's still not what killed him. He died from being burned.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, not burned. Irradiated. Because the virus had no effect on him. The crew members who were affected by the virus couldn't control him, so they killed him, by irradiating him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Then why not kill Mulder? Or Agent Doggett? Why kill only this man?

speaker: SCULLY
line: This man must have been a threat, because of something he knew.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That I don't know.

speaker: SKINNER
line: So even if we did know, and were able to give word to them, It'd put Mulder and Agent Doggett in danger too. Wouldn't it?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: ¿Su familia? ¿Fotografía? Your family? You want to get back to them? I can help you. Señor. Confía en mí.

speaker: GARZA
line: Yo no confío en nadie.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Right. Trust no one. If you stay here, they will find you, just like your friend. Let me go. I will get you back home. You have my word. Mi promesa.

speaker: TAYLOR
line: Where's Garza?

speaker: TAYLOR
line: Where is he?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'll go get Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Get up, Agent Doggett. There's more where that came from.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know anything about radio, Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, I know a little.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let's see what little you know and get that ship-to-shore working.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Call who?

speaker: MULDER
line: Anybody who can get us off here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Get to work!

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Doggett!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm working on it.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think this door is going to hold much longer.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wagner?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What do you want?

speaker: MULDER
line: I take it back. It's perfect.

speaker: VOICE ON RADIO
line: Orpheus, this is the Marine Operator. I repeat, this is an emergency priority transmission for the Galpex-Orpheus.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, you got John Doggett on board the Galpex-Orpheus. Come in.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This is John Doggett.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully, yeah, I'm right here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can you hear me?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yes!

speaker: SCULLY
line: What was that?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's someone knocking on the door.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, listen to me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think I know why they killed this man, if not how they killed him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Right now we got bigger problems. We need a chopper.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We've got choppers on the way.

speaker: MULDER
line: Tell her all the men here are infected. She's got to get the word to the choppers. Not to land on the platform.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, how they supposed to get us?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that problem is rapidly becoming moot!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully, listen - there are three men on board here that are not infected, me, Mulder and a man named Diego Garza who may be mentally unstable, could be why he tried to wreck this radio room just like his friend Simon de la Cruz. He may resist rescue attempt because he believes there are men in flying saucers who are coming to get him. Agent Scully, do you get that? Agent Scully?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're breaking up!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What the hell are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: Destroying their ability to transmit just like Diego and Simon de la Cruz.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm talking about contact.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Contact with whom? The mother ship?

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Doggett, listen.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Now you just back off.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no, no, listen.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where they go?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know, and I don't want to stick around to find out.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let's go, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Mulder! I can't leave him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Diego Garza.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Doggett!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: ¡Diego! ¡Diego! ¿Donde estás?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Diego, get up. Come on, let's go.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is he coming?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No.

speaker: VOICE ON RADIO
line: Come in Galpex-Orpheus.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Doggett, I think I know why they let us go.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What?! Agent Mulder, what are you talking about? What's going on?

speaker: MULDER
line: They're going to blow the rig.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Who?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Let's go.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What's he saying?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think he wants us to jump.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Now, wait a minute Agent Mulder, I'm in charge here. On two count.

speaker: MULDER
line: How about a 20 count?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: One! Two!

speaker: MULDER
line: Where's the fire, Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I've been called up to see Deputy Director Kersh. As have Agent Scully and AD Skinner. I think it's all hitting the fan.

speaker: MULDER
line: You mean Galpex Oil?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Word came down that Galpex has lost the right to drill that entire Texas oil province.

speaker: MULDER
line: That oil should stay right where it is. You should do everything in your power to make sure that it does.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Me?

speaker: MULDER
line: That is the Deputy Director calling to tell you there is no need to see you. That the blame has been properly assigned for what happened out on that platform. I'm out. 86'd, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What do you mean. You're out of the FBI?

speaker: MULDER
line: Kersh could barely contain his happiness. He stuck it to me.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So, you taking the fall?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Not for me?

speaker: MULDER
line: For you. For the X-Files. You're all the credibility this office has left. You have Kersh's ear and you have seen it now. Out on that platform. You saw it for yourself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Answer the phone, Agent Doggett. You're in charge here now.
